results.title: Light: reflection
results.brief_description: Discusses the law of reflection and formation of images. Illustrates the different types of reflection, and demonstrates the formation of real and virtual images in the plane, convex, concave and parabolic morrors. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Light: lenses and optical instruments
results.brief_description: Explains how lenses function. Shows the similarity of the operation of a simple camera to that of a human eye. Demonstrates the effects of different lens curvatures and systems of lenses. Discusses the uses of lenses in eyeglasses and other optical instruments. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Explains how lenses function. Shows the similarity of the operation of a simple camera to that of a human eye. results.title: Light years
results.creator_credit: Kathryn Millard, Patricia L'Huede and Lexicon Films
results.brief_description: Light years layers photographs, landscapes and stories to construct a sharply focused portrait of photographer Olive Cotton and the images and philosophies that have shaped her life and work. As one of Australia’s most accomplished photographers with a portfolio spanning sixty years, Olive and her story offer a rich insight into Australian life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kathryn Millard, Patricia L’Huede and Lexicon Films

results.title: Light waves and their uses
results.brief_description: This elementary explanation of light deals with the following points: the principles of reflection with plane, concave, and convex mirrors; refraction in connection with lenses, with particular reference to the human eye; the principles and applications of interference; polar screens; the electro-magnetic spectrum; the quantum theory.

results.title: Light the empty places
results.creator_credit: Andrew Swanson and Crawford-Senior Film Productions
results.brief_description: A retired school teacher recounts his schooling, teacher training and teaching experiences in various schools with re-enacted sequences. This is followed by a survey of contemporary school facilities and specialised education services in Victoria. Features the Horsham High School Choir. Celebrates a centenary of State education in Victoria 1873-1973.

results.title: Light on East Anglia
results.creator_credit: Associated British-Pathe and British Travel Association
results.brief_description: Shows the changing aspects of life in East Anglia from the tranquil dawn until the fading light of evening. Scenes include the rural charm of Suffolk with sleepy one street hamlets; the Norfolk Broads with stately riverside homes; student life at Cambridge; crumbling relics of monastic life in Norfolk; and fishing trawlers from the North Sea. Narrated by William Dexter.

results.title: Light in the darkness
results.creator_credit: K Khandpur, M. Bhavnani and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Today there are more than 50 schools for the blind in India where children as well as adults receive education and training. The Central Braille Printing Press at Dehra Dun is dedicated to serving the sightless. The training centre for the adult blind, also located at Dehra Dun, is one of the most important centres of its kind in the country. Weaving is among the principal technical trades taught.

results.title: Light illumination and its measurement
results.brief_description: Illustrates the common sources of artificial light and explains their operation. Describes in detail the measurement of light, indicating luminous intensity, luminous flux and illumination. Explains and demonstrates such basic terms as candle power, lumen and foot-candle.

results.title: Light control through polarisation
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and Moviegram Films
results.brief_description: Sketches the nature of light waves, the focusing of a light beam, the spectrum and the use of color filters. Diagrams are employed to explain the theory of polarisation.

results.title: Lifesaving
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the swimming strokes best adapted to life-saving: how to approach a swimmer in difficulties, breaking holds, carries, methods of rescuing by boat and by ring buoy, and the Schafer method of resuscitation.
